person.persName: Thomas N. Lindsey (Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and paymaster general)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and paymaster general. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Son of John B. Lindsey. Married to Isabella P. Weisiger Lindsey in 1834. Father of Daniel W.Lindsey, John B. Lindsey, Maria Lindsey, Lucy W. Lindsey, Thomas N. Lindsey, Mary B. Lindsey, and Joseph W. Lindsey. Married to Lucy Benham Applegate Lindsey. Educated at Augusta College in Augusta, Kentucky. Studied law under Richard Southgate in Newport, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1832 and practiced in Newport. Relocated to Frankfort in 1835. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Franklin County from 1843 to 1845. Commonwealth's attorney in the Eighth Judicial District from 1845 to 1848. Member of the Whig Party. Representative for Franklin County at the 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Franklin County in 1850 and from 1855 to 1857. Member of the Democratic Party. Paymaster General of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861.
